GabText You feel the walls of vines pulsate a little bit...
There is a huge insect sitting here...
"But alas, you are not one of us... not just yet at
"Tell me - oh filthy human... do you want to kneel in front of me?"
"Your humility... pleases me... I might just make you one
with our kind... one day... yes..."
"But for now... you are a peasant."
"Say it! Say that you are my peasant!"
"Peasant - there is a lowly being on the upper levels...
A wretched being who wishes to be like us..."
"The being... wants to soar the skies... but we cannot allow
that... not from someone as miserable as him..."
"Murder that being... I want to see it's blood flow...
"Then leave... you disgusting piece of flesh..."
"Just know that one day... you will become a rotten home...
"And that day... might be sooner than you think..."

"Hah! I guess I misjudged you previously!"
"This place is truly curious, isn't it?"
"They say these are the intestines of the god of the depths."
"That means we are inside an older god!"
"Would you like to join my party?"
"Have you found what you are looking for?"
"Ja, yes. He is not that well known god as he is mostly
worshipped by those who are forsaken and forgotten."
"His people often shy away from light and prefer dark
"You've seen the cavedwellers yet? They prove my point
"The god of the depths is responsible for the layout of
these dungeons. He is ever-changing his shape to challenge
"I'd try to please him, if I were to delve deeper."
"Would you like to join my party?"
"Hmm... To be honest. My verdict on you is still open."
"I don't trust you to put it bluntly."
"Your party seems big enough as it is."
"I don't like packs of too big in size."
"Have you found what you are looking for?"
"There is a man imprisoned somewhere in these dungeons."
"The man has something that shouldn't belong to any human.
"And perhaps get rid of the man while at it... He carries
an omnious energy with him. I'm not sure what to think of
